identificationModule.officialTitle: Clinical Impact of Cardiac Resynchronization Therapy on Heart Failure Patients With QuickOpt and Echo Optimization

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to demonstrate that QuickOpt optimization can be as an alternative method for CRTP/D patients' optimization in clinical practice through the comparison of the improvement differences between the CRTP/D patients with different optimization at 12 months after implantation.The hypothesis is that the Heart Remolding parameter (LVESV) improvement of patients using QuickOpt parameters at 12 months after implant is not inferior (10%) to the patients by Echo optimization。
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
Clinical studies have demonstrated that the AVTI from QuickOptTM related significantly to the max aorta VTI (AVTI) by Echo, the concordance correlation coefficient (CCC) was so high from 0.96 to 0.99.

But up to now, there are no clinical trials to evaluate mid-long term clinical outcome for CRTP/D patients by QuickOptTM and Echo optimization, this is indeed the main purpose of the study; in addition, the clinical impact, the status of arrhythmia and agents of all the enrolled patients, will be evaluated at 1 year after implant.

armGroups.label: Quickopt Group
armGroups.description: the QuickOpt Group patients will be optimized by QuickOpt(IEGM);

armGroups.label: Echocardiography group
armGroups.description: the Echo Group patients will be optimized by Echo.

interventions.name: Cardiac Resynchronization Therapy
interventions.description: Patients will be optimized using QuickOpt (IEGM) algorithm installed on the Merlin device programmer within 2 weeks and 3 and 6 months after device implantation.

interventions.name: Optimization using echocardiography
interventions.description: Optimization of the AV/PV and VV delays using echocardiography

primaryOutcomes.measure: Percent Change in Left Ventricular End Systolic Volume (LVESV) at 12 Months Compared to Baseline
primaryOutcomes.description: The primary outcome is the percent change in LVESV at 12 months compared to baseline. This outcome measure is assessed through evaluation of echocardiograms at both baseline and 12 months, with a decrease in the percent change in LVESV at 12 months indicating clinical improvement. The percent change in patients with devices optimized with QuickOpt is compared with that of patients with devices optimized using standard echocardiography techniques to determine if one method of optimization results in a greater change in LVESV.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* • Patient meets current CRT-P indications and be implanted with an SJM CRT-P device with V-V timing and a compatible lead system

  * Patient is able to provide written informed consent for study participation

Exclusion Criteria:

* • Patient has limited intrinsic atrial activity (≤ 40 bpm)

  * Patient has persistent or permanent AF
  * Patient has a 2o or 3o heart block
  * Patient's life expectancy is \<12 months
  * Patient is \<18 years old
  * Patient is pregnant
  * Patient is on IV inotropic agents
  * Patients who are ongoing other devices or agents study
  * Patients with heart transplanted or waiting for heart transplant
  * Patients with Hypertrophic and obstructive cardiomyopathy
  * Patients with severe aortic valve and mitral valve stenosis or regurgitation without replacement

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change in Left Ventricular End Systolic Volume (LVESV) at 12 Months Compared to Baseline
outcomeMeasures.description: The primary outcome is the percent change in LVESV at 12 months compared to baseline. This outcome measure is assessed through evaluation of echocardiograms at both baseline and 12 months, with a decrease in the percent change in LVESV at 12 months indicating clinical improvement. The percent change in patients with devices optimized with QuickOpt is compared with that of patients with devices optimized using standard echocardiography techniques to determine if one method of optimization results in a greater change in LVESV.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: A total of 108 patients in the QuickOpt group and 118 patients in the Echocardiography group had LVESV measurements at both baseline and 12 months to allow comparison of the percent change in LVESV.

seriousEvents.notes: Death; not related to study devices
Patient hopitalized then expired; death not related to study devices
Heart failure deteriorated; patient expired; SAE not related to study devices.
Patient sustained cardiopulmonary arrest. Patient expired. The death is not related to study devices.
Patient sustained junctional rhythm and low blood pressure. The event was considered related to study device. The pace maker was re-interrogated.
Heart failure deteriorated. Patient hospitalized. The event is not related to study devices.

seriousEvents.term: Heart failure deterioration, elevated left ventricular pacing threshold
seriousEvents.notes: Heart failure deteriorated. Left ventricular pacing threshold increased. The event is not related to study devices.

seriousEvents.term: Heart failure deterioration, myocardial infarction, venous thrombosis, death
seriousEvents.notes: Heart failure deteriorated. Patient sustained myocardial infarction and venous thrombosis. Patient expired. The death is not related to study devices.

seriousEvents.term: Heart failure deterioration, phrenic nerve stimulation
seriousEvents.notes: Heart failure deteriorated. Patient experienced phrenic nerve stimulation. The event was considered related to study devices.

seriousEvents.term: Myocardial ischemia, staged heart bypass surgery
seriousEvents.notes: Patient was diagnosed with myocardial ischemia and underwent staged heart bypass surgery. The event is not related to study devices.
Patient stated chest distress and short breaths. Patient was hospitalized. The event is not related to study devices.
Patient sustained cerebral hemorrhage. Patient expired. The death is not related to study devices.

seriousEvents.term: Haematoma, low right atrial lead sensing
seriousEvents.notes: Patient sustained haematoma; the right atrial lead sensing decreased. The event is not related to study devices.
Pacemaker pocket skin ulceration. The event is not related to study devices.
Patient's body rejected pacemaker. The event is not related to study devices.

otherEvents.notes: Patient experience phrenic nerve stimulation. The event is not related to study devices.
Patient sustained coronary sinus dissection; the event is not related to study devices.
Right ventricular lead dislocation/displacement; the event is not related to study devices.
Right atrial lead dislocation/displacement; the event is not related to study devices.
Left ventricular lead dislocation/displacement; the event is related to study devices.

otherEvents.term: Elevated pacing threshold of left ventricular lead; lead dislocation/displacem
otherEvents.notes: Elevated pacing threshold of left ventricular lead; lead dislocation/displacem; the event is related to study devices.
Patient sustain infection at pacing system; the event is not related to study devices.
Patient experienced anaphylactic shock; the event is not related to study devices.
